text: While the Dor-Stop is a cute place on a nice tree lined street, I'm not sure what the big fuss is all about. The food was only fair and they don't even have real cream for your coffee. It's that nasty fake nondairy crap. It also gave me the heebeegeebees due to the "Christianesgue" motif.

We love this place! There's this guy in the kitchen who has a shaved head and a beard.  If you see him back there, my wife says he makes the best over easy eggs she's ever had.  The breakfast meats are awesome and so are the pancakes.  Prices aren't too bad either.  Staff is fun too - they'll start to know you after stopping in a few times, it's nice.  Check this place out!

I grew up just South of Pittsburgh and had never visited the Dorstop restaurant until just this past weekend. I was looking for a place to meet friends for brunch and came across the Dorstop on Yelp. 

The restaurant is quite small and there were a lot of people eating there but service was fast and we did not have to wait long. I had the breakfast burrito and thought it was delicious! Everyone at my table really enjoyed their food from their omelets, to their fancy flavored homemade pancakes etc... I liked it so much that I went back a few days later with my Mom and Sister. They both really enjoyed their food as well! I would highly recommend this place for breakfast or brunch (as that was all I tried.) I will certainly come back any time I am visiting Pittsburgh. Great find!

WOW!  Great staff and great food.  Got in quick and got out quick and cheap.  Did the regular breakfast with 2 pumpkin hot cakes on the side and they were out of this world.

I'm glad they were on YELP or I never would have none of my new favorite breakfast place.

TC

Recently visited the Dor-Stop for Sunday brunch and my experience was phenomenal.  It was busy but the turn around time is super fast so the wait isn't long at all.  Food was great.  I recommend the French toast (just the regs nothing fancy). And ps- the home fries are ridiculous, I don't know how they do it but if you try them and don't like them, you've got problems.  Another plus my coffee cup was always full.  Great experience and the staff is awesome and very attentive.  Thanks Dor-Stop!  I'll be back...

This place has some seriously good breakfast.  They have many good things.  The pancakes looked awesome and I would get them next.  I had the Guy's version of the jumbot and it was delicious.  The cinnamon rolls are great too!  
It is a busy place for good reason.

Great service and atmosphere and even better food! My husband's go to is the raspberry stuffed French toast but we've had many items from the menu and everything fabulous. There is almost always a wait on the weekend, but it goes by quick!

Loved dining at the Dor-Stop.  I was visiting from New York and dragged a local along with me.  He had never been and is kicking himself for the years of lost happy tummy.  Cute place with good service and hearty food.  Everything was fresh and homemade.    They are open until 2pm on Sunday.  We got there around 1pm and it was a difficult decision - breakfast or lunch?  Breakfast or lunch?  We both chose lunch.

Delicious sandwiches - I had the pittsburgh turkey sandwich (turkey, swiss, french fries on grilled italian bread --- served with POTATO PANCAKES!), he had the Chic O' Philly Hoagie (chicken, onions, peppers, lettuce, tomato, and cheese on a split loaf with french fries).

German potato pancakes are delicious!
We spent about $20 and had a filling but not too ridiculous meal.
Airways interesting specials. Great potato pancakes!  Be prepared to wait at lunch and on weekends. Service is always good.  Cozy neighborhood spot.

The Dor-Stop is my new favorite place to have breakfast, narrowly beating out my own kitchen table. I love the eggs, the home fries, and the friendly but harried service. The Dor-Stop is almost always packed with customers, and for good reason. 

One small quibble: please, for the love of all that is holy, get rid of the fake-o Mrs. Butterworths and put out some real maple syrup for those tasty pancakes. Really, Dor-Stop, you're worth it. I believe in you.

I was expecting phenomenal but got good. I was pumped on the hype of Diners, drive ins and dives so maybe my expectations were too high for a breakfast dive. Service is a little on the slow side while you get pumped with coffee, nice staff, cramped noisy dining area, with a grumpy looking chef who can't smile. We had three different orders each was good, a bit over priced but thats because they have a line of people waiting to take your spot if your not willing to wait.
Love these hot cakes. A must do when you are in Pittsburgh. Get there early always a line. It's just that good! come with a big appetite these hot cakes are HUGE!!!!

I've been living in the neighborhood for almost a year now and finally got to try out this place. It did not disappoint!  I've been asked why I have it only 3 stars with such a glowing review. Well, I don't prefer greasy spoon joints, but if it's your thing u will like it! 

What makes this greasy spoon joint different than others is the amazing variety of pancakes and french toasts- you will not get bored with your breakfast here! As a standard on the menu, they have many flavors to choose from: pumpkin, banana, blueberry, choco chip, raspberry, etc. I ordered the special of the day: chocolate cherry cheesecake pancakes. They were pretty good! I liked that there were actual cherry pieces in the filling- I appreciate real fruit being used in my breakfasts. If u like a pancake that holds up against the weight of toppings and syrup, while maintaining a soft spongey texture, you will like these. I hate when pancakes get immediately soggy- these do not! 

The boyfriend ordered Bob's specialty, as it is not a standard breakfast item either- eggs with German potato pancakes, applesauce, and sour cream- it did not disappoint! The potato pancakes were a tad on the sweet side, but I liked them. 

Another great thing here is the down-home feel of the place- everyone is very friendly. While we were waiting in line (which by the way, wasn't too long, they get people in and out pretty fast), they handed out small samples of coffee. This was much appreciated on such a cold day!

Yelpers, once again you all came through!  Being fairly new to the city, the only real breakfast place I have found is Pamela's.  After reading Yelp this morning my friend and I went to Dor-Stop.  You guys rocked!  We had to wait 20 minutes but walked around the neighborhood (really should do a huge workout before AND after eating here!) then it was time for us to be seated.  The waitress was excellent!  They were packed so it took about 30 minutes to get our food but she kept our glasses of iced tea filled the whole time (and brought out a new glass of ice for each of us to refill).  I ordered the pancakes while my friend ordered a vegetarian omelet.  We ordered one order of potato pancakes to share.  

Both us really enjoyed our meals a lot!  Thanks again Yelpers, now I have a new favorite breakfast place!

BEST pumpkin pancakes I have ever had in my entire life and I've had a lot. It was totally worth the 20 minute drive and the 20 minute wait. Moist and rich in the middle, just like my favorite pumpkin bread, and crispy on the edges. Didn't even need syrup.  There were a bunch of other delicious sounding pancake options that I wished I could have tried too, like apple cinnamon and banana oatmeal. 

Vicki's jumbot was really good too - everything savory and delicious scrambled together. The ham from bone in it was what made it special and I don't even usually like ham. Next time I might just get a side of ham to go with my pancakes :) 

Service was great too - real friendly, and everyone kept trying to refill my coffee as if their life depended on it. 

I'm not in Pittsburgh that often, but I will be coming back to Dor-Stop next time I visit!!

Didn't even know this was a DDD place. We just searched Yelp for something decent in Pittsburgh. The Dor-Stop did not disappoint. The stuffed raspberry French toast was insane. The waitress warned me it was really sweet, but I felt that it was perfectly balanced.

Definitely check this place out, and don't be freaked out at the potential of long waits. We waited 20 mins at 10 am on a Saturday. You'll be fine.
Best pancakes in Pittsburgh besides DeLucas. Always delicious and the service is nice.

My first review was filtered for some reason. If you want a full picture of this place, be sure to read the filtered reviews as well. Many of them are not positive, and would lower the 4.5 star rating if fairly counted.

I really, really wanted to try Dor - Stop, but it wasn't open when I went! My wife and I woke up early just to go there, and the diner was closed for the next few days, EVEN THOUGH IT DIDNT SAY THAT ON THE WEBSITE! Such a waste of time. If you're going to go, make sure you call ahead, just so you don't get screwed over like we did.

Been to a lot of places in the burgh for breakfast. This place is the best. No questions asked. Pancakes are to die for and the Guy Fieri jumbot is insanely delicious. The place makes Pamela's and DeLuca's look like the McDonald's drive thru.
Been here twice. Hate to say it but nothing special. The usual breakfast items but nothing stands out either in preparation or presentation.

Very average place.  Waaaay over rated.  The food took forever to come out.  Then the home fries were lame. My toast didn't come as ordered. Eggs were good.  It's not bad, it's just not as great as everyone says it is.  They got on TV and now its like some Mecca.  Just average, don't expect more.

HOLY MOLEY that was some good breakfast at 2:00 in the afternoon!  I had the oatmeal pancakes and I have not stopped thinking about them since.  My wife had a vegetable breakfast burrito, and I stole some so I can say that was pretty awesome too.  
I'm now looking for an excuse to get back to this part of Pittsburgh so I can eat here again.
If you love a great home breakfast, this is your place. The pancakes made from scratch were incredible.

It's worth the drive over to Dormont. The owner realized I was a visitor, came over and chatted with me and asked me to sign the guest book. I had not seen the DDD episode, but read about it here and elsewhere. Bob, the owner, is delightful and the banana walnut hotcakes are amazing. I'm not sure it has been made clear but this is not banana flavoring, but hunks of banana. Wonderful!

OMG!  Hands down the best pancakes I have ever put in my mouth. Sometimes I day dream about Dor Stop pancakes.  Too bad I live 6 hours away or I'd go there everyday.  

The service was just ok, but the place was packed and the food was well worth the wait.

The Dor-Stop restaurant has an enchanting, old fashioned look inside and out that effectively conveys its main appeal: good simple cooking at reasonable prices. The menu has typical diner favorites. I ordered the ham off the bone breakfast (with their special ham, potato pancakes, eggs, and toast) and true to form, it was very good (ham was still relatively moist despite having been on the griddle) and was reasonably priced at about $7.   

I went around lunch time on a weekday and the restaurant was about half full, so I didn't have to wait. Food came quickly and service was good (even though the young waitress oddly addressed me as "honey" every time).  As I was finishing up, an older gentleman, seemingly a "regular," came in and was greeted warmly by the waitstaff. He took a seat at the counter and the staff told him what specials they could make for him. (He ended up getting a chicken salad sandwich on texas toast plus a bowl of soup.) And he chatted with the staff as he enjoyed his lunch. I'm guessing that this guy like many others are regulars here and know what a great place this is and keep coming back.
Excellent food, potato pancakes are fresh and served with applesauce or sour cream. Great lunch sandwiches and also a nice diner atmosphere.

Great little breakfast place! Portions were perfect, not too much, not too little.  We were there on a Tuesday morning and it was busy busy, I can on l  imagine what a weekend would bring. That being said I would wonder how the wait staff would handle the people because they were not very pleasant.  That took a little away from the experience but not a deal breaker.  We both had pancakes and they were amazing.  The wife had chocolate and banana, yummy! I had plain but still a great taste!!
For an great little breakfast stop I highly recommend.

I had no idea that this restaurant was "legendary" when I decided to eat there this morning with my family.  I was severely hungover and just needed some grease, and the concierge at my mother's hotel happened to recommend this place.

The restaurant is "cozy" (read: small) and situated in a really quaint neighborhood at the top of a massive (and somewhat scary) hill. The restaurant itself was buzzing and had a great neighborhood vibe. Despite it being *packed,* we were seated right away.

The menu wasn't too fussy but there were a lot of options. I ordered the dor-stop burger (burger with sauteed onions and green peppers, american cheese and two slices of texas toast) and fries. My husband got the mushroom swiss burger with onion rings and we split our meals. The food was simple enough but amazingly delicious. I think they battered the onion rings in crack. I also ordered an orange juice, which I could tell was fresh squeezed.

The portion sizes were reasonable too! Not gigantic, which I appreciate. I finished my meal feeling like a brand new woman. 

I think I'll look for reasons to come to Pittsburgh now that I know this restaurant exists. Yum.

My sister and I both got the banana and chocolate chip hot cakes, and we loved them! Huge servings and you can also get the hot cakes with bacon, sausage, and ham for a slightly higher price. This was my second time going actually and if I could go every day I would! Highly recommend!
Went here after a wedding, the wait was long but worth it. I think we about ordered everything b/c we couldn't choose and it was all good from the eggs to the pancakes. I will be back.

Been here only once and it will be our last. Local neighborhood food hole with average food, coffee. Don't know what people find so special about it. I guess it does have an old, greasy spoon charm but that doesn't justify the trek halfway across town. There are definitely much better places in Pittsburgh.

 Waitress also weirdly loud and attitude-y, I'm sure she thought she was being very friendly and just kidding around and being friendly - but she walked a fine line between teasing and being self righteously indignant towards  my husband for not 'treating me right and paying attention to me' then went on to ask me why other Indian women wear black gowns that cover everything and eat through slits in their mouth holes and don't say a word. I felt more like she was on a crusade to save me and my brown skinned self from my 'ignorant' husband than serving us breakfast and leaving us in peace to enjoy the morning. 

May be great for other people, but not my kind of breakfast experience. Maybe I can't take a joke?

* 

Thought back on this experience a lot - I'm editing my review to local neighborhood food hole with racist undertones.

Before I start, this place has some solid breakfast dishes but nothing to rave about and not worth the 30 min wait. On a road trip I recently took with my family, it was literally the only breakfast place that disappointed us and did not live up to its hype.

Got the "famous" Ham from the Bone breakfast. Without a doubt, it was definitely good and a solid item to order, but it didn't blow me away. Wish I had tried Guy's version instead of the original...

My wife ordered two eggs over easy and they were undercooked, to the point of pretty much being raw. Gross. Breakfast places should know how to properly cook eggs.

We split Lori's Stuffed French Toast, which everybody loves. Again, definitely a delicious and solid item to order, but didn't leave me speechless or anything of that sort.

At the end of the day, you don't HAVE to go here. It's not a MUST. If you do go, you will get a more or less solid breakfast that is above average. Again, I don't think it's worth the wait or lives up to its hype, but I'm a foodie and know mind blowing food when I eat it.

My brother recently moved to Pittsburgh so my family and I were visiting him and looking for a place to go to breakfast. We settled on Dor-Stop. Walking in, it looks like your typical hole-in-the-wall diner, very small with not a ton of seating which is ok because they get people in and out fast. We put our name in and waited about 15 minutes then seated at our table. My mom ordered a egg white omelette, my brother ordered a sausage an cheese omelette, I ordered one banana chocolate chip pancake and a Western omelette, and my dad ordered some pancakes and eggs with some sausage. 

The pancakes were amazing. Very delicious, fluffy and large. . Everyone else was satisfied with their meal. If I were to get here again I would order just pancakes or some of their french toast. My omelette was good but nothing amazing. If you want good pancakes and french toast then I would go to Dor-Stop their eggs and other menu items weren't terrible by any means just nothing to write home about.

Never disappointed here.   You can come here and have a great consistent experience.  Breakfast is really good.  You will not be disappointed no matter what you eat.  

Would give 5 stars if the place was bigger.  You are practically sitting on top of people there it is very tight and the seating is not comfortable.

My husband and I had the most wonderful breakfast here! The food was dynamite and our only regret is that we do not live closer to Pittsburgh so that we could go there more often. I had the raspberry stuffed French toast, which was out of this world and my husband had the banana pancakes, which I believe was a special, and he rave about them. I would highly recommend this diner to anyone!

First off, the food was good, but there was a LONG wait and two of our party had to sit on a window sill next to our table. We would go back again if we could get a better table. It was very similar in theme and everything else to Square Cafe in Regent Square. The joint had a larger seating area. Would hit up the Dor-Stop again though.

The Dor-Stop is a great small breakfast restaurant.  Once you enter the doors of pancake heaven you are greeted with friendly staff and the delicious smells of pancakes and meat on the griddle and other various breakfast aromas.  We came Sunday for breakfast and, boy does this place fill up!  

The Dor-Stop has gained fame from Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives, but that's not what I care about! I just want the food!  So, that's what I did, I ordered the food after ordering my coffee.  Their menu has all of the classics including their signature pancakes, omelets, french toast and eggs cooked to suit.

My coffee cup and water were kept full and while sipping on my caffeinated beverage, my meal came.  The Dor-Stop produced my order of two eggs over medium, and two large banana, chocolate chip pancakes.  I was speechless once I took a bite of that cakey, breakfast goodness (the pancakes not the eggs!).  The pancakes are really delicious. They have the perfect texture, the perfect taste, the perfect look, the perfect smell... need I go on?  The eggs were good too, I don't want to leave them out, but what egg is going to win again the battle of pancakes v eggs?

Breakfast Breakdown,

The Food: Delicious!
The Value: I believe my two egg combo was $7.99. Breakfast for four with coffee was close to $40. That's not too bad.
The Experience:  It's a small restaurant full of happy people! I happened to glance at the table next to us  and saw the breakfast burrito.  It's massive!
Would I return?: Why, yes. I wish I lived closer so I could eat them every Sunday.
5 stars?: I've been to a restaurant that claimed to have the best pancakes in the world.  They were wrong. The Dor-Stop has the best pancakes and for not claiming to have the best, they get 5 stars, because these pancakes were heaven sent!

Bonus game!: How many times were pancakes and breakfast mentioned in this review? Points to the winner!

My dad and I do a yearly trip to a different city to see the NY Mets play.  Yeah I'm a Mets fan and live in California.  Anyway back in May of 2012, we made the trip to Pittsburgh.  

Based on Yelp and local recommendations, we drove out to the Dor-Stop.  In the four days we were in Pittsburgh we ended up going two times for breakfast.  

Just awesome pancakes.   First time, I got the banana pancakes and my dad got the oatmeal raisin.  I love banana pancakes and these were pretty good.  But the oatmeal raisin were fantastic.  Next time both of us got oatmeal pancakes.  I opted for no raisins.  

On a side note, we frequently hit restaurants covered on DDD but I no longer trust that show based on some of my experiences and the Yelp reviews I've read.   I now will look up the Yelp review and ask locals if the restaurant is featured on DDD before going.

Huge portions, quick service, fresh and delicious food!  Had the raspberry french toast--nice and crisp with fruity toppings, the Guy--hot and spicy as I like it--had to take half home, and pancakes with ham and cheese in them--again so much we had to take them home. Coffee cups stayed filled, the place was buzzing with a constant flow of people, glad we were able to get a table--we will be back!
Went there with a friend. Had egg Benedict and did not like it. The turkey meat smells funny. And the waitress kept rushing us. Not sure why it's so crowded. Will not visit again.

I just love this place.  It's small, there's nothing fancy about the decor, and it's difficult to find a good parking space close by.  But I don't care.  The food is awesome.  Best breakfasts in Pittsburgh, hands down.   We don't get there as often as we'd like, but when we do go, we're always 100% satisfied.
We like it - great meeting place - maybe a little over rated on quality of food. Good but nothing to write yelp about. Pancakes didn't excel; eggs were just fine.

I've been here twice, for brunch, with some friends. 
My first time was confusing for my friend and I, because there was a line and we didn't know we had to sign in. After we were seated, we ordered food. The waitress was slow and unfriendly. She seemed irritated that we were there. The food was amazing, as our orders were small and uncomplicated, we just wanted to try the food. The second time was pretty much the same. The food was great and filling, but the servers were unfriendly and slow. Disheartening and not really worth dealing with for some pancakes. Try it out for the legend, like I did, but beyond the food, it's not much.

Loved it! Tasty food and friendly service!

Visiting there from out of town and decided to check it out. We went on a Saturday morning so we expected a long wait but it was only around 15 min. 

We had pancakes, stuffed French toast, bacon and eggs. All were yummy! Prices are reasonable and worth it for the good food and friendly service.

Would make the trip again to go there!

A busy Sunday place at 12 noon. Clean and friendly employees. The food was fresh and good. I especially LOVED the potatoes lyonnaise! I ask for eggs over medium and got over easy. The bacon was good but a tad too salty for me. The pancakes where very tasty however thick and heavy. I like a thinner lighter pancake. 
I will return to try the stuffed French toast! Looked and smelled Devine!  
Definitely a great place to eat and socialize! Even the guests were friendly!

Best breakfast in Pittsburgh. Hands down, no competition. My favorite meal is their breakfast sandwich with bacon. It's on Italian toast with lettuce, tomato, and mayo. In the fall I love the pumpkin pancakes! And if you're in the mood for something sweet you have to check out the raspberry stuffed French toast - just unreal. Not to mention that the servers are incredibly friendly. This place is family owned and has such a great vibe.

I have been here many times. This place lives up to the hype. You have to get the hot cakes. Try all of the flavors over several visits. I haven't has a bad pancake here yet . The flavors and consistencies are excellent. Easily the best pancakes on pittsburgh. They also have great French toast is pancakes just aren't your thing.
Excellent food, good prices, and speedy service. I've eaten here 4 times and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a down to earth casual dining spot.

Amazing, awesome breakfast restaurant.  The pancakes are to die for, no matter which variety you choose, and there are LOTS of varieties.  Make sure you show up hungry, or you may have a difficult time finishing your food.

Great staff and a good price.  Highly recommended.
What's not to like about this place?  It's a friendly, bustling little diner. Very busy on weekends.
Stopped in on a Sunday morning, very busy! It was obvious why. Good vibe,  fantastic potato pancakes.  Great hotcakes and a perfect over-easy egg.  Will return.

This place is great to have down the street from me. It was featured on a food network show so it's very popular. There is ALWAYS a line. Do not expect to walk in and be seated immediately unless you're there first thing in the morning or 10 min before close. They are worth the wait though. Best to go with 2-4 people and if you bring more than that it will be very difficult to seat you. They have tiny booths and tables only. Once again...it's worth the struggle. Their French toast is to die for and I constantly order the West coast Benedict.

Do I really need to write a review of this place, you know it is good. I'm a breakfast guy and usually go with a simple egg and toast breakfast but today I went with the eggs Benedict that was really freaking Delicious and the portion was gigantic to me. For the $8 or so I spent it was a hell of a deal. 

My only recommendation to someone who hasn't been here before is to just not even come here on the weekends it is such a pain, because it is so busy. Come here during the week for a  more relaxing breakfast.

I love this place. Normally, it would have been 4.5 stars, but since they moved to a smoke free environment, it gets a 5 star rating. The staff is quick, friendly and very "with it." This is a true family business and the food is fantastic. I love the jumbot! It's amazing and hearty. The coffee isn't the best, but the food makes up for it. The french toast and pancakes are lovely too. This is not the place to go if you are dieting as they are GENEROUS with the butter. I like this place way better than Pamelas, which, apart from the strawberry crepes, doesn't really do it for me. It was recently on the Food Network too so I'm not the only one that feels that way!

I was a little skeptical when I heard that this was one of those "TV" places. I've been to Georgetown Cupcakes and Carlo's Bakery, and they both failed to live up to the hype created by their TV fame. The Dor-Stop remains unaffected by stardom, however, and that is a very good thing. We showed up on a Tuesday morning at around 9:30 and there were plenty of open tables. As noted by almost everyone else here, the service was top notch, the prices were reasonable and the food fantastic. I had the banana chocolate chip pancakes and they were out of this world! I'll be back!

I'd say a solid 3.5 stars. Been there only once, for brunch. Loved the German potato pancakes - worthy of 5 stars. But I'd give the Eggs Benedict only 2 stars. I'll be back to try more of the menu and get some more of those potato pancakes.

Went here for a co-workers bday, will be a lifer!

Had the raspberry french toast, it was the bomb.

Water was ice cold, service was quick, prices were cheap. And as i said earlier.

THE FRENCH TOAST IS THE BOMB. 

Pancakes looked really good too.

First time eaters-- we loved it! Not a good place if you are counting calories or fat grams but great diner breakfast. Kitchen is a tad slow so don't be in a rush. But the raspberry French toast and the pancakes were relish-- and wow, full plates, couldn't finish either!
It's so good I get two meals ,, to hard to decide on 1 ... Got to get stuffed raspberry French toast ! It made national television :) get there early it gets busy fast

The Jumbot is very good, you won't leave hungry that's for sure,staff is very friendly, the place was packed but they moved people in and out very quick, definitely worth the wait also the banana walnut pancakes rocked

This restaurant was featured on Diners, Drive-ins and Dives on the Food Network and was the basis of our visit. 

Located in the cute neighbourhood in the South part of Pittsburgh, Dormont, this little diner has a full breakfast and lunch menu. We got there just in an hour before they were closing for some lunch! 

I ordered the turkey Reuben with latkes as a side. It was delish! The sandwich had the right amount of sauerkraut. Their pancakes looked wonderful, will have to order them the next time I am in the area. 

Add this place to your list when you visit Pittsburgh!
Best pancakes I've ever had by far. Definitely worth the wait and the drive to get there.

A Dormont classic! You can't go wrong with Dor-Stop. Fresh, homemade meals made to order. This is one of my favorite breakfast places in the area, and I am not a big breakfast fan. The only downfall is the inside is extremely small. Watch going during weekend mornings because it gets very crowded. Due to its size, dor stop is not good for large groups. They serve both breakfast & lunch, and the waitstaff is incredibly friendly. I also love their coffee, whatever brand it may be! I recommend trying some homemade soup, not matter what meal you're going for... it's always fantastic!
A little gem...great service and food. Raspberry French toast, crab Benny, Guy's omelet...and MORE!
Great place for breakfast. Made to order. Pancakes are to die for. There is usually a line on the weekends. Great nostalgia on the walls.

I do not get the hype behind this place. I have been here 3 times now and the only thing I would recommend are the pancakes. I should have just stuck with the pancakes on my last visit but I went with a meatloaf sandwich instead.  It was just average and didn't really have any taste. It came with mashed potatoes which were definitely from a package. I always wondered why this place didn't stay open later now I see why, everything that isn't a pancake is a failure. 

The worst part of this last visit was the service. We arrived and the place was half empty and we were seated at a table. The waitress was just kind of like what do you want, now I don't expect every place to be trader joe's type happy but don't act like we are bothering you for coming here. She took our order and that was last we saw of her. Someone else brought out the food and no one ever came back to check on us. I could see the waitress go over to her other table (she only had 2 tables) and check on them multiple times. We didn't get any refills on our drinks and every time I tried to motion to her she would turn her back and sit at the counter and talk with the other waitress. We never even received our check and had to go to the counter and ask for it our self. We were then told to wait because they needed to check someone else out first. After standing there for a couple minutes we were then given our check. No apologies or anything.  I won't be back.
Amazing place with super awesome breakfast! We had the veggie burrito for breakfast and it was simple amazing. Will definitely come back here when we can.

Stopped in one morning randomly, had heard good things and decided to give it a try.  Had no idea that the Christmas Parade was about to pass by, no wonder there were so many people standing around!  Our 4 year old hears the sirens and realizes Santa is coming, but we just placed our order.  Uh oh.  The staff puts our order on hold, and tells us to go outside to see Santa.  We watch the parade for a few minutes, and when we go back inside, our order hits the table the same time as us.  

I know there is a wait for tables most mornings, so it was especially nice of them to be so accommodating and child-friendly.  We have been back may times since, and the food is always amazing and the staff is just the best.
I had the Italian jombot here it was so good, and the service was awesome!!! I will definitely be back.

Absolutely the best pancakes I've ever had. I ordered the pumpkin hotcakes, and they were really nicely spiced-- slightly sweet, so full of cinnamon and nutmeg flavor that I didn't need syrup. They were dense AND fluffy, somehow. My companion got the german potato pancakes, which were deliciously oniony, and spicy sausage that was SO bursting with flavor and a satisfying snap when bitten,
I used to live down the street and never made it here before.  What a shame.  Food was delicious, inexpensive and the service and atmosphere were great.   I will be back for brunch some weekend.

I have been here before, and it's just as I remembered it.  Came here with my husband, heavily pregnant and wanting pancakes.  To be clear,  I dislike pancakes.  My memories of them are the shake-in-the-container bisquik crap my mother used to make.  Hate pancakes.  But, wanted good ones, and was in the area.  Early weekday morning, so parking wasn't terrible, but still not easy.  Dormont is a cramped, busy area with an abundance of metered parking.  We were immediately seated, and asked by 3 different servers for our drink orders.  Hot coffee was immediately given, and never reached less than half of a cup, even after I said I was done. I ordered the apple cinnamon pancakes and my husband ordered a steak and cheese omelet with homefries.  This place boasts its appearance on "Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives", and there are articles sprinkling the diner.  It is usually always busy, and feels like a traditional diner: small space, bustling, and noisy.  There are a lot of locals, but we were not treated any less for not being familiar faces (we are from Pittsburgh, just not Dormont).  Food arrived hot, and my pancakes were coated with powdered sugar.  I avoid the syrup, as having lived in New England for a number of years, I will only use maple syrup on...anything.  I avoided the corn syrupy topping offered on the table, and am not sure if they offer maple syrup as a substitute (should never be a "substitute"!).  The cakes are great by themselves, and taste nothing like the buttermilk terrors of my childhood.  These are airy, cakey, and some would say, overly sweet--even without the powdered sugar.  The cinammon was lost in the breakfast, and the apples were, to the best of my knowledge, not canned. I could only eat about 1.5-2 of the 3 beasts, and snacked on my husband's homefries.  As others have commented, the homefries are not uniform diced or shredded potatoes.  They are soft, with the right amount of brown from the griddle, and slightly under-salted.  They are real potatoes that likely don't come from a freezer.  Wish there was a meal where I could maximize my carbs (pancakes, homefries, bacon--you get it).  All-in-all, this place is unique in that it can offer pancakes that I will eat, and is a well-known spot for a lot of Pittsburgh residents, certainly those in the South Hill.  Television appearance aside, it's still worth a try, but I recommend a weekday morning.

Stopped here recently for breakfast and it definitely does have that small town diner feel to it, but other than that, it's not really all that special. Most diners I've experienced tend to have regulars and the wait staff is extremely attentive. This was not really my experience here. My waitress seemed distracted and disinterested, and the service was quite slow, even though it was not a particularly crowded time.

My banana walnut pancakes were good and I liked the hot chocolate, which wasn't too sweet, nor too bitter. My bacon was not particularly crispy, but rather a bit too greasy for me. I would go here again, despite the little imperfections, though.

I had the farmers omelette, which was amazing. My friend had the breakfast burrito which he really liked, but it came with an inexplicable amount of shredded lettuce on the side for some reason. The restaurant was nice and clean, and it was busy for a Saturday but not unbearably so. I do wish that they had some breakfast meats for people who can't eat beef or pork, but that's a minor critique. We'll definitely be visiting again.

After remembering seeing the Dor-Stop on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives, we stopped here for breakfast on a Sunday morning at around 10AM.  Beating the brunch rush was great.  We had a short wait but were seated quickly.  Service was friendly, if a bit rushed.  My omelette was tasty, as were the accompanying home fries.  Everything was fresh and well-prepared.  I would return, and it's the kind of local joint I'll look forward to bringing out-of-town guests to.
The food was OK, but the service was slow.  This restaurant is really small and crowded.

Their hot cakes are the best around! The best "fall" combo is the pumpkin chocolate chip hot cakes, I even get them in the summer, so tasty! If you live in Pittsburgh and have never been here, this should be your next breakfast spot!

Raspberry stuffed French toast.  A massive omlet with everything but the kitchen sink in it.  Home cooked flavor from open faced sandwiches to bacon and eggs.  This is why you go to The Dor-Stop.

As busy as this place gets, there's always a seat ready when you go to walk in.  It's like magic.  This is an essential Sunday breakfast spot in Pittsburgh up there with Pamela's.  More than affordable you will leave stuffed.

After watching Diner's Drive In's and Dives this restaurant caught our attention.  After finally making it to Pittsburgh it was the first place we tried! I had the Jumbot (the mix of potatoes, eggs, ham. peppers, onion and cheese etc) It was great and hit the spot perfect with a Pumpkin Pancake! The coffee was hot, the service was friendly and quick, and very attentive! Great start to our trip to Pittsburgh!

For what it's worth, dor-stop isn't good as people say it was. People are fanatical about this place and its food. Is their food really tasty or they're popular because the network show? From my perspective, I detest their service, the service is notoriously horrible and unacceptable. Also the food was unpalatable. I order pumpkin flavor pancakes and side order scramble eggs. I was too full and their portion is huge so I left two pieces of pancakes. The waitress don't even bother to ask me if I need a box to take it home or if everything is good. Although she did refilled my coffee once, I barely see her stop by and there wasn't too many people in the diner is isn't likely she is occupied by that amount of customers.I think the waitress was rude because she never say thank you during the entire breakfast even when I tipped her. I should have known, I just feel like they treated me differently that's all. This review is based on my dinning experience and the service. Seriously if they mean business they should improve. Especially waitress was lack of enthusiasm. Do I want to come back? Never ever.

We met friends there for breakfast yesterday (they were able to accommodate our group of five by having one of us sit on the windowsill, but he's thin; ha ha) and we LOVED the Dor-Stop!  It's not very large and it's *very* popular (we arrived at 9:00 a.m. [on a Sunday] and it was already very crowded, which we normally wouldn't want to bother with.  However; we knew about that situation in advance, and actually we didn't have to wait too terribly long for a table).

I ordered a vegetarian (three-egg) omelette with egg whites, which came with toast & hash browns - and my husband ordered a vegetarian burrito.  We both ordered coffee, too.  The food was *delicious* & portions were quite sufficient, and the coffee was pretty good (a little too weak, but better than at most diners [and also more expensive, at $1.89]).

Our server was *terrific*; she had a great sense of humor (we had a very amusing conversation with her) and she was also very attentive.  The people at the cash register (who also took names for tables) were friendly, too.  Afterwards, I complimented the wife half of the owner couple (who have owned the Dor-Stop for 26 years) and also their daughter & the (three) cooks.  All of them were very friendly and the cooks had a great sense of humor.

Our (two) meals cost $22.17 with tax (but before the tip).  The restroom was clean, too.

Just like the TV show claims, this place is no joke (diners drive-ins and dives).

So go with one friend, you'll get sat faster.  Then, order your pancake choice (chocolate chip just makes sense) and the scrambled up thing that I forget the name of.  Just them them you want the thing you're supposed to get that's not pancakes, they'll know.  And share it all.

Fantastic.  And it's so close.  I should brunch there weekly.

This hurts my heart to write this because I want to like this place soooooo bad. Small town diners are what I live for.  I went a week or so ago for the first time and will give it a second try and can hopefully give a high rating.

I read the rave review of the pancakes, and this guy LOVES pancakes. On the fence between oatmeal and pumpkin, I opted for pumpkin. The fact that I was able to get this in March made me a happy guy.

To my dismay, I should've picked up some powdered donuts and buttered them up. It would've been more moist. They tasted like sugar. I didn't get any cinnamon, nutmeg, pumpkin flavor I was so desperately hoping for. Just super sweetness. They were very dry as well. I love a nice moist pancake and was bummed it didn't happen.

Another lesson, don't order grits north of the Mason Dixon line. I keep forgetting everybody does instant or minute maid grits without seasoning or butter. My bad on that. I have to try the oatmeal pancakes and give this joint redemption. Service was very good and ambiance was perfect, hence 3 stars.
The best breakfast ever. Choc chip pancakes did not need syrup- bacon suitable crisp and flavorful.

I've been coming here for years and you can't go wrong with anything from their menu. When I heard they were under new management, I was sad, hoping that the quality of the food wouldn't change. But good news! The food is still amazing! My favorites are the eggs benedict, Lori's stuffed French toast and any of the hot cakes. But like I said, you can't go wrong with anything you order. Hands down, the best place for weekend brunch.
Crowded but serves a killer breakfast...highly recommended

We've been here several times, and the food is always good. Nothing spectacular, or amazing, but always filling and tasty. Typical breakfast fare. I love anything benedict, but as a veggie, hate havint to pay for the ham, and order it w/o ham. So a waitress here taught me a little money saving trick, which I will always be grateful. Order texas toast, two eggs over easy and a side of hollandaise sauce. Then build your own eggs benedict. Saves a vegetarian about $2 on a main which is great!
    I would give it four stars if it weren't for the insane busy-ness of this place. It would be really great if they could expand. They also could really use chairs and benches outside for people who are waiting. I'm sure it's better during the week, but as a 40 hour a week working couple, weekends are the only time we can make it there.

My husband and I took my parents to The Dor-Stop to try a new place for Sunday brunch. The first thing that caught my eye was that this restaurant was visited by Guy Fieri on his Food Network TV Show "Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives"! Being a Food Network lover myself, I was pleasantly surprised. We arrived at 10:30am and had to make our way through the line of waiting people to put our name in for table. The line extended out of the door as we were told it would be about a half hour before we were seated which was reasonable considering the length of the line. We were seated within that time frame as the lined continued to grow. 

After we were seated we were instantly served by a waitress with water and any additional beverages that were requested. The menu had selections focused on breakfast and lunch, a variety that would satisfy anyone walking through the door. From eggs, hot cakes, and french toast, to burgers, and sandwiches, the options are there. I ordered the Banana Chocolate Chip Premium Hot Cakes as recommended by our waitress and they were outstanding! They were loaded with chocolate chips and bananas alike, with both items used as toppings as well. I could not have been more pleased with my selection. My mother ordered the Stuffed  Raspberry French Toast, the feature on Guy's TV Show, and it was exceptional. The portions were more than generous and the service was excellent. The waitresses worked together to make sure that all the customers needs were met especially as the waiting line continue to grow outside of the restaurant's walls.

The interior of the diner has a retro feel with a multi-colored tile floor, small booths and tables with limited walking space in between, a sit down food bar with old fashioned bar stools, and a color palette of greens and tans throughout. Numerous pictures of individuals were scattered on the walls and large windows with deep window sills allow customers to observe the streets of Dormont. There is free on-street parking throughout the area but if one chooses to go on a weekend, as we did, one may have to walk a few blocks to the restaurant. 

If you are willing to wait outside or in tight spaces for a half hour for diner food, this is a place you must try! Make sure to stop by before early afternoon breakfast, brunch, or lunch as they close by 3pm Mon-Sat, and 2pm on Sunday!

This is a classic. 

If you like old diner throw-backs with quality food...you should get there early. With only a handful of tables the demand for seating and stuffed French toast is always at a high. 

They've been featured on DDD and deserve more credit than that. 

Great for couples, families, solo and for hangovers.

I typically enjoy my visits to the Dor-Stop.  The banana and chocolate-chip pancakes are probably the best pancakes that I've ever tried.  I appreciate that they have some vegetarian breakfast options.  The line at this place is always crazy, but if it's a nice day, it's no big deal.  We sometimes wander over to the small bookstore.  My husband loves the "Guy's Version" of Vicki's Jumbot ham.   i usually get an omelet, and they're ok.  Nothing out of this world.  I'm not a big fan of the potatoes of any version at Dor-Stop, and I think to me, that's the biggest disappointment.  Other than that, the pancakes alone are worth a trip!

Don't believe the hype.  I will tell it to you straight.  Good oatmeal and good portion.  Coffee weak.  Fries are low quality, batter coated, tasteless, and very small portion.  Main complaint is the "sausage wafers" and "bacon shavings".   Since these are the most expensive items for the owner, he/she provides the customer with sausage thinner than a quarter and see-through bacon, with very small portions for both.  Did not try pancakes, but will assume they will be good since pancake batter leans more toward low-cost such as oatmeal, cereal, other such items.  Will not return.  Sausage was also greasy and very little spices to it, more like it was microwaved.  Forget your dreams of a thick, burger like fresh sausage patty filled with sage and other country spices that is about 4 ounces thick and substantial...what you will get instead at the Dor-Stop is a lukewarm, greasy, wafer-like sausage impersonation.  Forget about your dreams of thick, sizzling hot, applwood smoked bacon slices that are 6 inches long and quarter-inch thick.  What you will get instead at the Dor-Stop is lukewarm bacon pieces/shavings that are greasy and see-through.  This is all the truth.
Great pancake combinations (Oatmeal Raisin Pancakes) and Eggs Benedict styles. Friendly service, competitive prices, bustling Western PA diner atmosphere. Highly recommend!

Just like any other diner. The food is good, but I don't understand why there's an hour wait every day. I know it was on television and all, but it really just tastes like any other breakfast food. Not worth the hour wait and the claustrophobia within the walls.
Best breakfast around Pittsburgh, love coming here when we get a chance.  Never disappointed and I'm sure you won't be either. AWESOME

We have been wanting to come here for awhile and we finally had a free weekend to stop in. We came on a nice warm sunny Saturday around 1. We were seated immediately. 
We are huge fans of triple d so we like to visit all the places Guy has stopped . When we sat down, we weren't exactly ready to order, so our server said she would return. We looked through the menu and found what we wanted. Another woman came over to take our order not our waitress. She took our order and we just hung out. 
Our food came out about 20 minutes later. My boyfriend order Guy's Jumbot and I had the spicy omelette no cheese with grits and wheat toast. The food came out hot and ready for us to eat. My boyfriend loved his meal and said it was just enough food for him (he has a heart appetite). My omelette was a decent size but didn't have many jalapeños in it so that was disappointing. Overall, the meal was good but the service was not super great. The restaurant was pretty empty and we didn't order too much. We just needed water and we didn't get a refill which was frustrating. Not a huge deal but worth mentioning .
We will most likely return !

Well, looks like I'm adding yet another 5-star review for Dor-Stop. But hey, they definitely deserve it! In fact Dor-Stop is so good that I came here two days in a row a couple weekends ago - once for a sit-down meal, and once to get a meal to-go just so I could try a second item on the menu.

I actually hadn't eaten at Dor-Stop in years until earlier this month - their hours and my schedule don't tend to mesh. But one afternoon I just happened to be using 1/2 a vacation day, so I came with a family member. Since it was the middle of the day on a Friday, the place was fairly empty, which I definitely didn't mind - this place is pretty cozy and so it gets cramped quickly during weekend dining rushes.

But on to the food, the important part of this review! My dining companion ordered a salad - complete with French fries, 'cause that's how we do salads in Pittsburgh - and I ordered their Feta Burger. Sure, their Raspberry stuffed french toast caught my eye...but Feta burger! How often do you see that on the menu? And I loved that burger, by the way - it was well cooked and the toppings blended perfectly (I snagged a few mushrooms from my companion's salad which made it even better), and definitely felt like good diner food. I left feeling super happy with my meal.

Buuuuut...the next day I still couldn't get that french toast of my mind. I just couldn't. So I called in an order for pick-up - good thing I did, too, because there was nowhere to sit when I came in! Saturdays are definitely jam-packed here, understandably so. Well, I got my food, brought it home, and proceeded to devour it. Just, YUM! Seriously - that french toast is a MUST!

If I was going to complain about anything it would be that the seating really isn't the most comfortable on the planet, buuuuut...I can't hold it against them. I just can't. Not after that french toast. See you next time, Dor-Stop!

Great little local diner!! Must go if your in town.  Food was amazing and all made from scratch!!  Had the Pumkin Stuffed French Toast today!! Perfect size portions. Wait staff super friendly. Gets crowded, but never a long wait. Highly recommend.

The Eggs Benedict was delicious.  The Dorstop does a good job with hollandaise sauce.  My husband got a ham omelet and his was very good as well.  The place was crowded this morning and I can understand why.  The food is delicious and the prices are reasonable.

Though Pittsburgh is flooded with incredible B/L/D locations and is quickly becoming a foodie destination, Dor-Stop remains one of my favorite breakfast places (if you can get in!). 

The food has that home-cooked comfort food taste every pallet can appreciate. The "greasy spoon" vibe here is charming and extremely low-key, though their pride regarding appearing in Diners Drive-Ins and Dives is made very apparent (and rightfully so).

I variety of specialty pancakes is very enticing. We're not talking crepes here either. These things are a seriously thick, wide cake feast. I personally love the oatmeal pancakes the most, but enjoy every kind I try. The Raspberry filled French toast is now my favorite dish. It's not truly filled, but rather "crowned" with a creaming light raspberry filling. The toast is crusted in corn flakes, which doesn't sound as good as it actually is.

I have visited with friends and enjoyed the experience, but only recently did I bring my 4yr old and 3yr old nephew and niece--a dangerous proposition at many restaurants. We were greeted with a smile upon arrive and the children received special placemats and crayons to keep them occupied while we waited a short period of time for our breakfast. The children's selections were appropriately prices and portioned and at no point in time did I feel as though I had made a mistake bringing them to one of my favorite breakfast locations.

This place is only AMAZING!  They seated us as fast as possible despite the long line out the door!  The food was nothing less than amazing (definitely try the French Toast and the sausage gravy and biscuits!).  Their waitresses are also 100% efficient without losing that caring touch! Our waitress was extremely attentive which is not something you expect with a place that's this packed and has all the hustle and bustle. Definitely  coming back!

Cute little diner spot, a little outside Pittsburgh. I enjoyed myself! Despite what appeared to be a waiting line, I got a spot at the counter right away. I had a clear view of watching the cooks flip up pancakes and scramble eggs- pretty fun. The food was good. I found out about this place from DDD. If you are in the Pittsburgh area and have time to stop, I would recommend it :) It's a little spot and has diner hours, so make sure you go when they're open. Enjoy!

Used to be... until Guy, Now it seems they rest on those Laurels. Well loved hotcakes now always raw and mushy in the middle. Potato pancakes? limp and soggy. This is based on more than one visit.
Last time service was dreadful. No water refills. Order was wrong, twice with no apology.  Charged for wrong order and for something not ordered at all.
Great Breakfasts!  Worth the wait to get a table since Diners,Drive ins and Dives had been there. Pancakes are very fluffy and waffles too!

BEST BREAKFAST I'VE EVER HAD!!! I had the Guy's Version of the Jumblot. My girlfriend had the chocolate chip banana pancakes. These were the best pancakes I've ever eaten. They have a texture and gooeyness that I've never had in a pancake. The Guy's Version was eggs, potatoes, jalapeños, tomato, cheddar, and hot sausage. The hot sausage had the most amazing flavor. 

Everyone should definitely make a trip here once! Pancakes are to die for!!

Went here thanks to numerous recommendations from other yelpers. We were glad we did. Definitely small, so a wait should be expected on busy weekend mornings. Luckily we went during the week so we were seated immediately.  Food was great though, and service was quick and friendly.

It's in a neat area too so come for breakfast/brunch then take a walk.

Had breakfast here while in Pittsburgh for a few days. The place will remind you of a mom & pop breakfast shop, it has that home cooked feel. I took the advice of fellow yelpers and went later in the day. I was a party of one and there was a small table available. I decided to try the chocolate chip & banana pancakes, they were very tasty, but got a bit mushy in the center, they weren't undercooked they were just loaded with bananas. I had a side of bacon to complete breakfast and freshly brewed iced tea to wash it all down. 
Service wasn't bad but could have been better, my server never stopped by after my food was served and i had to request my check from a different server. 
Good breakfast, I recommend giving them a try

Great place. My first time there was today and we went for breakfast. I had one of the specials, a peanut butter banana bread French toast. I loved that it was something very original as compared to a standard breakfast item you can get anywhere. 

It was three good sized pieces of banana bread, with a good thickness to them, and definitely filled me up. The only thing that I would say is missing was a little more peanut butter taste, as I didn't get much of one. Other than that it was great. The side of bacon that came with it was also a good portion size.

The overall price of $32 for three people was fairly priced and they had a bunch of other things on the menu that I would have wanted to try as well. I'll definitely be back
The food here is amazing. I've never had something I didn't like and the serving sizes are enormous! The place is a little small, but service is fast. Well worth the wait if there is one.

Great breakfast spot. Their pancakes are amazing! This is a go-to place in the South Hills. The service is always friendly and fast. Casual and laid back atmosphere, good coffee. A Pittsburgh staple. I took my family here for breakfast when they visited from New York and they loved it too.

To be honest, I really don't understand all the hype about Dor-Stop. Maybe it's the fact that it was featured on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dive? Or it gives you that small town, homey diner feel? None the less, I have definitely experienced better.

We stopped in on a Saturday morning to meet my brother in law's family for breakfast. They arrived 10 mins earlier than us and were able to get seated right away. Because there were 9 of us, they had to accommodate accordingly in their small facility so things around our table were a bit cramped. No big deal though, it's understandable. 

Dor-Stop is known for their pancakes but because I am not fan, I opted for the Potato Pancake breakfast which came with 2 potato pancakes and 2 eggs, cooked to your liking. You are able to add a side of meat for $2. I added bacon with mine. Our food took quite some time to come out. There were 2 tables that came in after us that received their meals before us. Kind of irritating as we're all on the verge of getting hangry, but we assumed they're holding some plates behind so they could bring all of our meals out together. I really wasn't too impressed with my meal. The potato pancakes were good but they're very greasy as was the bacon. I had to use a napkin to soak up some of the excess grease. The eggs were good though. They're light and fluffy which is how I like my eggs to be when scrambled. 

The staff member who was refilling our coffee was very nice, our waitress though, was not. She was not very attentive and never had a smile on her face. She got an attitude when my husband asked for an orange juice to go and snatched our check off the table because she had to add another OJ to it. This could've been easily fixed if she were to ask if any of us needed anything else before bringing our checks out. He also asked for a to go box in which he never received it. My brother in law's mother had to go up to the counter to get her box because our waitress didn't bring hers either.. Maybe it was because she was too busy chatting in the corner with another staff member to even pay attention.

All in all, it wasn't a very pleasant experience and I was not impressed, which is quite upsetting since I've heard many great things about it.

Great restaurant, good food fun place, but they don't serve any butter, none in the restaurant at all.  If you don't like margarine you're out of luck, and they definitely don't care, either, they took quite an attitude about it when asked.  How hard is it to buy some single serves and keep them in the refrigerator for those who ask?

Four stars for the food, three stars for the service. I was really disappointed by the fact that the waitress tried to charge us for bringing in Starbucks coffee. Granted that I later discovered the sign on the door that indicates no outside food or drinks; however, it's also the smallest sign on the door. Furthermore, I didn't appreciate the fact that this was brought up to us after we were seated. They clearly saw us come in with the coffee in hand, as we had to wait to be seated.

In my opinion, this could have been handled better. Most places would remind you of their policy and ask that you note it for the future. Instead, we were railroaded to pay for two outside coffees. Accordingly, we changed our order to go because of this.

With that said, I'm still giving this establishment four stars because I truly enjoyed the food. I just wish that they had better customer service, as I most likely will not return due to that distasteful encounter.
But If you want to beat Mark at Axis & Allies just tell him that he has to be a Russian sub and nothing else - he'll get all g

Like many others before me I came to the Dor-Stop with high expectations and let me tell you, my expectations were exceeded.

My girlfriend and I have been looking for a new breakfast spot for a while and the Dor-Stop has always been high on my list to try.

The place is classic, still has a bar counter, kitschy items adorn the walls and the a feeling that you are dining in your grandmother's restaurant. The place is always packed but we were quickly seated and like many have stated before my coffee cup never fell below 3/4 full before it was refilled.

Now lets get to the nitty gritty: the food.

I got the pancake breakfast, usually a very simple and easy breakfast but when the breakfast came I was so impressed. The hotcakes are so different, some would even say magical. They are so fluffy and moist and complimented their super crispy bacon. I almost wanted to fold the entire breakfast up and eat a giant pancake eggarito. My mouth is watering thinking about it.

My girlfriend got the breakfast sandwich which was very well done. Their ham is so succulent and tender. They cut it off the bone at the Dor-Stop and is shows. The sandwich is a work of art and is the classiest breakfast sandwich I have ever seen. 

I recommend this place to anyone and will definitely come back to try some other types of pancakes. They are the best in the city.

Oh and try the potato pancakes, they will rock your world.

This is probably our favorite place in the area for breakfast. Be prepared for a wait before being seated. Most of the items on the menu are pretty good. Service has declined a little over the last few years. The wait staff is a little pushy and outspoken- especially the one with neck tattoos. They could use to leave sweeteners on the table. Those are the only two reasons that I didn't give this place 5 stars. Otherwise, we love going here and we would recommend it to anyone who lives close by!
The specialty hot cakes (pancake) is very good. The recommended dishes are superb. I got the crab Benedict and two of my friends got the guy's version. All of them are very tasty.

Saw the reviews on Yelp and had to give this place a try. I came in for lunch around 2 PM, when the restaurant wasn't too crowded. 

I found the diner itself to have a lot of character. The decor is interesting, and it's in a real quaint, old neighborhood. I sat at a table right at the window and could watch the people and traffic go by on the street. 

The turkey sandwich I had was a solid choice and was fixed in Pittsburgh style with fries and cole slaw in it. The interesting part was the potato pancakes that came with the sandwich. I liked the way they were prepared, and they had some seasoning that gave them a nice taste. It's good to have something a little different than fries or chips with a sandwich. 

Service was real quick and friendly, and prices were reasonable. This place merits the high rating it has received.

Love the dor-stop! One of the best breakfast places in Pittsburgh! Wait staff are always super friendly and on top of things and food is always delicious!! The wait can definitely be long especially on the weekends, but it's worth it!!

Quick stop for brunch before heading into Canada. Nice small local place with a great staff. Everyone from the hostess to the waitress was very pleasant. 

The food was good, it hit the spot. I had the Crab Benedict and it was a decent portion. Wish it was larger but it was a fair size. 

Over all experience was a 3 1/2 stars

This little diner was packed on a Sunday morning. It was recommended by a local who hadn't actually been but read a review and said it was featured on restaurant show. So our expectations were pretty high. My friend and I ordered the banana chocolate chip oatmeal pancakes and potato pancakes to share (because I can never decide to go sweet or savory for breakfast!) The potato pancakes were unremarkable: small, soggy, on the sweet side. The ham we ordered with them though was delicious. The oatmeal pancakes were perfect though and you get three huge, thick pancakes! I loved the hearty texture and I could even skip the syrup. My kids got French toast and feta burger raved about both. I wish the server had pointed out the specials menu though because our neighboring table ordered that and it looked amazing.
2 stars only for the food.  The food is what makes me come back...The service is horrible, it's what's keeping me away.

My breakfast was absolutely phenomenal. I specifically ordered the ham and eggs because it included their famous potato pancakes. They did not disappoint I tried every trick in the book to get what they put in them but no luck. I even promised some things I should be ashamed of LOL I would definitely recommend that if you are anywhere within 50 miles you need to make a trip here!

Great food with a local twist.  Service was amazing.  Raspberry tea is a must try.  Kids got grilled cheese-yum!  Try fries with gravy.  Pancakes are too good to be real!!  This place is worth all the hype.  A must try and super kid friendly.

Amazing pancakes!!!  Best place for breakfast in Pittsburgh.

Ever since they were featured on the food network channel, the Dor-Stop is always packed on the weekends so you better get there early or be prepared to wait for 40 minutes.  It's worth the wait!  I love their banana nut pancakes - they are so moist and delicious!  They give you three enormous pancakes and for an extra charge you can also get bacon or sausage.  I always have one pancake to take home to eat for later and it still tastes great reheated.  This is my favorite spot for Saturday breakfast.

My nephew had a hockey game in the area, so I wanted to grab something for lunch. This place was the closest with the best reviews.
We waited for about 5-10 minutes for a table, it was 12pm so it was busy.
No need to write a review because it was awesome, portions were huge.
Service was friendly.

Very tasty.  Small, homey little place that we drove out to based on the reviews.  Pancakes were great...nice chew and texture to them, with a little crunch almost.  A nice change from your standard boring pancake.  The ham was juicy and a nice side as well.  Service was friendly.  Would not hesitate to return.

great breakfast place...period. worth the wait. had the stuffed french toast, and the bob's special. french toast was crisp and cooked perfectly, although not really stuffed, just an extra slather of raspberry jam. Bob's special was very tasty, German potato pancakes were a little under cooked but great tasting.  Service was quick and brisk, waited about 25 minutes on a Sunday morning, which was not bad but it was raining this day.

We had a good breakfast here although I felt the portion was a tad light. Everything we had which was a combo breakfast was tasty and the coffee was really good. I had scrambled eggs with bacon and pancakes.  The construction in the area is a loud annoyance but so be it. 
The paid parking is ridiculous but seems to be happening everywhere now. Thanks Dormont
All of their food looks so good it was hard to decide. Ended up getting the veggie burrito and all I have to say it OMG!!  It was SO good. I will definitely be getting that again.

I've been going to Dor-Stop for years (well before the DDD crowd arrived).  While I'm thrilled to see Bob and Vicky's crew thriving, I do have to say that I miss being able to actually walk-in on a Saturday or Sunday without a line around the block.

Irregardless, when you're looking for unique spins on traditional diner fare, this is your joint.

The pancakes are all fantastic.  I've had every combination on the menu and then plenty more (they'll usually grant a request if they have the ingredients and they usually run a weekend special).  I highly suggest the apple walnut, banana chocolate chip, the oatmeal raisin, and most importantly...  PUMPKIN (the best in town).

Lori's Raspberry French Toast is the obligatory first dine, just stay away from the other iterations that aren't first coated in corn flakes prior to landing on the griddle.

The jumbots, eggs benedict, and potato pancakes all also represent fantastic choices.  If you have a choice of meat, hands down get the "ham off the bone".

One other key note...  Bob, Vicky, and their daughter Lori go out of their way to make people happy.  They always bring samples out to those waiting for a seat and offer coffee to hold people over when it's cold out.

If you're running solo or with one in tow, I recommend you check to see if there are spots at the bar (first come first serve).

5 stars for the food, 1 star for service. The atmosphere and location were great. Since there was a wait we decided to sit at the bar. Not sure if that was a bad choice or not, since we got waited on right away. Once our food arrived no one came back to wait on us, we both needed refills on our water/coffee and placed them on the edge of the bar to make the process easier. There we multiple people around us to assist in this but no one made direct eye contact and we didn't want to waive them down, as this is their job and how they get tips. We decided we were done eating and they immediately took our plates, once that happened a lady who seemed like a manager came over and asked us if we wanted more coffee, but at that point we were so disappointed that we were ready to leave. We never even received our check or saw our waitress. We had to go pay without a check and tell them what we had ordered. We'll probably go back since it is close and the food was great, just hoping the service improves.
Fantastic. Best hotcakes around and I've never had a bad meal here.  The staff is friendly and personable.

This is your hole-in the wall diner. It lives up to the expectations, and I will say this: get there early!

I ordered something akin to a breakfast sampler, eggs, bacon, tater pancakes.  My friend ordered the raspberry french toast. 

The coffee, as others have stated, was a bottomless cup. Quite tasty too, as compared with many restaurants that will serve you the dregs of Folgers that essentially serve as methadone to the caffeine connoisseur/addict such as myself.

The french toast stole the day, it was hearty and delicious, with a yogurt/syrup topping. Definitely an indulgence. I did not give this 5 total stars as my eggs were slightly bland, and I love eggs. I will return to this marvelous establishment that really serves as a gem in Pgh neighborhood eating.

I love everything about the Dor-Stop. This place is a neighborhood staple that always delivers. I've only eaten breakfast here. You can usually expect a bit of a wait, but it's totally worth it. The french toast is my favorite but really everything is good. I love the local, friendly diner ambiance. The servers are all great. If you're really lucky and they like you enough, you might even get to taste to specials before you order. Do yourself a favor and try the Dor-Stop. You'll be hooked!
The only place so far that can make a fabulous potato pancake!  Crowded table set up but well worth the discomfort!

I've only been here once (yesterday) for breakfast.  I noticed that this place opens really early (6am) on weekdays so I had thought it would be a nice idea to get down to the Dor-Stop on our way out of Pittsburgh.

I was able to find parking on the street and the meters don't take effect until after 8am.  We had arrived around 7:35 so I figured we'd have enough time before I had to feed the meter.

There was only 2 other customers at the bar when we arrived.  We had our choice of seating and we had chosen to sit near the window.  Coffee up and ordered and our server was back consistently to make sure our coffees were filled.  On the table we noticed they had non dairy creamer and since both my wife and I aren't fans of non dairy creamer we had asked if we could have a small serving of milk and our server brought that over right away.

Being our first time I had to go through the menu to see what I was wanting.  I didn't want to eat too much since I had to drive back home but I did find something of interest.  My wife usually gets steak and eggs but she didn't this time.  I had sort of wanted her to get that so I could have some steak but she went with the ham and eggs with German potato pancakes and white toast.  

I had gone with the all American which was 1/3lb burger, eggs, and lyonese potatoes which is basically homefries with onions with toast.  I also ordered a side of bacon.  I noticed the side of bacon was 3.10 which is kind of a lot but they gave me probably 6 slices or more.  I'm used to only getting 3 or 4 slices usually.  

We didn't order anything that they could impress us with I suppose.  It's not like we went with an item like hotcakes or a skillet or anything like that just a relatively conservative breakfast.  I did have some of my wife's potato pancakes and ham and they were both very good.  My breakfast was just as I expected nothing out of the ordinary but still very good.

Great breakfast and the pancakes are fantastic! A few downsides, though. There's no free parking (meters available and a lot around the corner isn't enforced on Sundays) and there's always a wait. The wait for two hasn't been too bad for us- usually 15-20 minutes. Service is pretty good overall and it's definitely worth it!

Another 5-star find in the Pittsburgh area. I kid you not. Guy Fieri hyped the right place.  It is hands down the best diner in the universe.  Actually, I don't know that for sure, but I dare you to find a better diner anywhere in the United States.

The food here is made with love and that's what makes it stand out out. You can taste the love in every single bite.  The staff of this family-owned restaurant run like a well-oiled machine, used to the crazy crowds that come here every day to blow their diets and binge.  This was all a girl could ask for on a cheat day.

I had Vicki's Italian Jumbot but with Guy Fieri's twist on it, making it a little more spicy. It was more than enough for Jim and I to share.  We also shared the fantastic pumpkin pancakes. They do not need syrup at all. So fluffy, so delicious and gut-busting.  Why do I have to live in D.C?  I would be here every weekend for brunch.  There is nothing like this place over here..wahhh!   This place is great for sharing so order different dishes and eat them family style. The portions are gigantic and unforgiving! 

Anyway, do not come to Dor-Stop thinking they have become over-commercialized because  of their appearance on the Food Network. They have not. They are the same family-owned established where you can get no nonsense  service and absolutely amazing food.  If you are in Pittsburgh, run don't walk to Dormont and grab a seat at Dor-Stop.  This is a glutton's dream come true.

I'm not ashamed to admit it - I was skeptical.  As a long-time lover of Pamela's, I just couldn't see this place making me happy when we discovered Pamela's in the Strip was closed on Memorial Day.  The wait was torturous at the Dor-Stop too...however, it was a holiday so I suppose i understand.  And when we did finally get seated, the AMAZING hot cakes, SUPERB hash browns, and perfectly cooked eggs really made my morning!

I prefer my hot cakes to be thin and flat, and when I saw the ones here, I was unsure again.  But the taste will BLOW YOUR MIND.  I got the apple cinnamon ones - they are crispy yet fluffy with apples that taste very fresh and just the right amount of cinnamon.  I even enjoyed the butter as a sweet additive to a decadent treat!  The potatoes were also amazing - true lyonnaise style with crispy outsides, warm insides, and plenty of onions.  Eggs were standard fair, but overeasy is often executed poorly... so props for getting it exactly right.  Several of my friends also ordered different flavors of hot cakes and suggested the oatmeal ones are really not to be missed as well.

Despite the long wait and weird waitress, we all LOVED our breakfast and I was full for hours after.  YUM!  Can't wait to go back!

The banana walnut pancakes were fluffy and flavorful! I almost didn't even reach for the syrup they were so yummy. Eggs made to perfection. There are several specialty pancakes on the menu...I'll definitely be returning to try more!

Service was great. We were seated right away. We tried the apple and pumpkin pancakes. They were really thick but incredibly tasty. I loved the bacon. French toast and fried potatoes were good. Coffee was hot.

The Dor-Stop, we all have heard of this and have seen it on TV...each time I have tried to visit on the weekend the line has been quite lengthy.  But we went today (Friday) around 9am and was able to be seated right away.

The pancakes are what they are known for, so my arm was twisted and I had to try them.  I ordered up the Chocolate Chip Banana Pancakes with some bacon.  My early morning date went with Vicki's Italian Jumbot.  Both breakfast dishes were awesome.  The pancakes were light, fluffy and moist.  Ample amounts of bananas and chocolate chips.  I opted to forego the syrup and eat these up as is.  I was not disappointed.  It is like eating dessert for breakfast.   My date had the Italian Jumbot.  I have no idea what was going on with this dish, but wow it worked.  I stuck my fork into her dish numerous times to try it despite the 'angry scowls'.  There is a lot of potatoes, ham, eggs, onions, peppers, cheese and tomatoes in this hodgepodge.  

The service was friendly, fast and efficient.  They were always coming around offering up more coffee which I gladly accepted.  

The prices are well within reason.  They are equivalent to other diners but the food is WAY better than your standard diner.  

Hit this place up anytime you can...I wish I still lived in Mt. Lebanon so that I could roll into here each and every weekend.

The best diner in Pgh.
The best diner in Pgh.
The best diner in Pgh.
Homemade cinnamon rolls

Very cool place. 

I like:
- Lots on the menu. Big variety. 
- Food is great (details below).
- Friendly staff, from "hello" to "come again."
- Prices are very reasonable for what you get. Nice. 

Dislike:
